detaileddescription.para: Type defining callback status. This type is used for different connection status for the WLAN Connect function callback.
Type defining scan interval. This type is used for WlanConnect_scanNetworks function
Type defining the prototype which connection call back must conform to. This call back is called to notify the user when connection is established Returns the connection status as a parameter

Type defining the prototype which disconnection call back must conform to. This call back is called to notify the user when connection is terminated following the call to WlanConnect_disconnect(). Returns the connection status as a parameter
Type defining a pointer to char This type is used in order to pass the network Pass Phrase
Type defining a pointer to char. This type is used in order to pass the network SSID
Type defining a pointer to char. This type is used in order to pass the network Username

briefdescription.para: WLAN driver initialization function. This function initializes WLAN driver context and Hardware interfaces; Also initializes the WLAN Stack. This API should be called first before calling any other API.

detaileddescription.para: starts a LoRa join process
WLI Delete All Profiles interface. This function erases from memory all the stored profiles from WIFI Protected Setup functions.
WLAN driver de-initialization function. Performs memory deallocation, closes WLAN driver context and shuts down the hardware interfaces.

By default device is configured to STA mode even if device is in different modes (Like AP, P2P). If user want to change the mode, they need to use the Simple link API directly
none
Retcode_T The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code) Below shows the error code(last 2 Bytes) meaning
RETCODE_OK - Successfully WLAN driver initialized.
RETCODE_SIMPLELINK_ERROR - Not initialized WLAN driver. Example1 usage: Initialize the WLAN Stack and the WLAN Driver //InitializeWLANdriverandWLANstack WlanConnect_Init();

none
Retcode_T The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code) Below shows the error code(last 2 Bytes) meaning
RETCODE_OK - Successfully WLAN driver de-initialized.
RETCODE_SIMPLELINK_ERROR - De-initializing WLAN driver failed Example1 usage: Deinitialize the WLAN Stack //DeinitializeWLANstack WlanConnect_DeInit();
RETCODE_OK: join procedure successfully started RECODE_FAILURE: join error

briefdescription.para: WLI Connect to Open Network interface. This function connects to an open network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

memberdef.argsstring: (Retcode_T WlanConnect_WEP_Open(WlanConnect_SSID_T connectSSID, WlanConnect_PassPhrase_T connectPass, uint8_t passPhraseLength, WlanConnect_Callback_T connectCallback))
memberdef.name: BCDS_DEPRECATED

param.array: WlanConnect_SSID_T connectSSID, WlanConnect_PassPhrase_T connectPass, uint8_t passPhraseLength, WlanConnect_Callback_T connectCallback

briefdescription.para: WLI Connect to WEP Open Network interface. This function connects to an WEP Open network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

memberdef.argsstring: (Retcode_T WlanConnect_WPA(WlanConnect_SSID_T connectSSID, WlanConnect_PassPhrase_T connectPass, WlanConnect_Callback_T connectCallback))
memberdef.name: BCDS_DEPRECATED

param.array: WlanConnect_SSID_T connectSSID, WlanConnect_PassPhrase_T connectPass, WlanConnect_Callback_T connectCallback

briefdescription.para: WLI Connect to WPA Network interface. This function connects to an WPA2-PSK or WPA-PSK network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

briefdescription.para: WLI Connect using WPS PBC interface. This function connects to a network by using the Wi-Fi Protected Setup. After calling the function the user must push the connect button of the Router for around 5 seconds. Function is configurable in two ways:

detaileddescription.para: WLI Connect using WPS PIN interface. This function connects to a network by using the Wi-Fi Protected Setup. The function is configured with the following enrollee PIN code: 35072317. This PIN must be entered in the router interface after calling the function. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function
blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

memberdef.argsstring: (Retcode_T WlanConnect_EnterpriseWPA(WlanConnect_SSID_T connectSSID, WlanConnect_Username_T connectUsername, WlanConnect_PassPhrase_T connectPassPhrase, WlanConnect_Callback_T connectCallback))
memberdef.name: BCDS_DEPRECATED

param.array: WlanConnect_SSID_T connectSSID, WlanConnect_Username_T connectUsername, WlanConnect_PassPhrase_T connectPassPhrase, WlanConnect_Callback_T connectCallback

briefdescription.para: WLI Connect to Enterprise WPA Network interface. This function connects to an WPA2-PSK or WPA-PSK network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

briefdescription.para: WLI disconnect interface. This function disconnects from the WLAN network. Function is configurable in two ways:

listitem.para: blocking : callback parameter is set to WLI_NULL(maximum blocking in error case will be 15seconds)
non-blocking : callback parameter is set to the address of the user function

briefdescription.para: Function used to scan the available networks. Get the available scan information. List of scan results will be available via the call back function.

parameterdescription.para: Structure pointer hold the WLI scan information data.

simplesect.para: RETCODE_NO_NW_AVAILABLE - No network available to scan.

briefdescription.para: Function to get the current network status This function sets a disconnect callback which is used to notify the user that there has been a disconnection that was not triggered by the user.ed on connection status.

detaileddescription.para: This API must be called only after initialization

briefdescription.para: Function to get the connection status. This function return the connection status.
Function to get the connection status. This function return the connection status.

simplesect.para: WLANCONNECT_NOT_INITIALZED - Wlan module is not initialized.

detaileddescription.para: macro to represent the ssid of the device in WPS_PBC and WPS_PIN Security mode
This is the Enrollee PIN that must be entered in the router for WPS PIN Connection. The pin code is stored in the SFlash. The default pin code is 35072317.
Macro to represent Initialized state of Wlan
The max buffer for storing the MAC address length
The max buffer for storing the scan data
The max buffer for storing the SSID length
Macro to represent un-Initialized state of Wlan

briefdescription.para: Module Describes the usage Of Wlan Interface.

detaileddescription.para: The interface header exports High-level Wlan Interface API's for integrating with the Wlan Interface which are used to Initialize Wlan connection Open Wlan Connection with the WEP & Wlan Connection Get status by deleting profiles and de-initialize the wlan connection.
